text: Key Terms I Latency ‘The time it takes for a certain operation to complete in a system. Most often this measure is a time duration, like milliseconds or seconds. You should know these orders of magnitude: « Reading 1 MB from RAM: 250 s (0.25 ms) « Reading 1 MB from SSD: 1,000 ps (1 ms) « Transfer 1 MB over Network: 10,000 pis (10 ms) « Reading 1MB from HDD: 20,000 ps (20 ms) « Inter-Continental Round Trip: 150,000 s (150 ms) 1 Throughput ‘The number of operations that a system can handle properly per time unit. For instance the throughput of a server can often be measured in requests per second (RPS or QPS).
